column4: hi i am running an amd64 and i just setup a 32bit chroot to run i386 programs on and I am having a problem with apt-get
dpkg: syntax error: unknown group `postdrop' in statusoverride file
E: Sub-process /usr/bin/dpkg returned an error code (2)
http://pastebin.com/428372 (im an amd64 user and setup a 32bit chroot and I am getting that error when trying to apt-get upgrade)
when I try to use dpkg -i *.deb to install a file, I get this error "dpkg: syntax error: unknown group `postdrop' in statusoverride file"
what did you to do your system?
copying the /etc/group from outside the chroot into it is the simplest solution
'grep postdrop /etc/group', in the chroot, prints what?
then you didn't copy /etc/group into the chroot
what does it print outside the chroot?
what does 'dpkg -l postfix | tail -n1' print outside the chroot?
so you did remove postfix then
a) don't run it as root, b) that binary install you did is broken
